The selector `p` only targets `

` elements, so only the paragraph text is red.

output_questions.question:
Content
Other
output_questions.explanation: The `#main` selector targets the element with id `main`.

output_questions.question:
Heading

Text
output_questions.explanation: The `.title` selector targets elements with class `title`.

output_questions.question:
• One
  • Two
output_questions.explanation: The `li` selector styles all list items.

output_questions.question:
Box

Paragraph
output_questions.explanation: Multiple selectors separated by commas apply the same style to both elements.

output_questions.question:
<style>
header nav {
  background: gray;
}
</style>
<header><nav>Menu</nav></header>
output_questions.explanation: The descendant selector `header nav` targets navs inside headers.

output_questions.question: Note
output_questions.explanation: Only span elements with class `important` are bold.

output_questions.question: Footer text
output_questions.explanation: Paragraphs inside an element with id `footer` are green.

output_questions.question:
<style>
input[type="text"] {
  border: 1px solid #333;
}
</style>
<input type="text"><input type="button">
output_questions.explanation: Attribute selectors target only text inputs.

output_questions.question:
• Alpha
  • Beta
output_questions.explanation: The child combinator `>` targets direct children `li` of `ul`.

output_questions.question: Section title
output_questions.explanation: Descendant selector styles h2s inside sections.

output_questions.question:
A note

Regular paragraph
output_questions.explanation: Only paragraphs with class `note` get the background.

output_questions.question: Main box
output_questions.explanation: The selector `div#main` targets div with id 'main'.

output_questions.question:
Header

Text
output_questions.explanation: The universal selector `*` applies to all elements.

output_questions.question: Hover me
output_questions.explanation: The pseudo-class `:hover` changes the color on mouseover.
